title: Monophysitism
summary: Monophysitism (/məˈnɒfɪsaɪˌtɪzəm/ or /məˈnɒfɪsɪˌtɪzəm/) or monophysism (/məˈnɒfɪzɪzəm/) is a Christological term derived from the Greek μόνος (monos, "alone, solitary")[1] and φύσις (physis, a word that has many meanings[2] but in this context means "nature"). It is defined as "a doctrine that in the person of the incarnated Word (that is, in Jesus Christ) there was only one nature—the divine".[3]
